docs.title: My Dev Notes
docs.text:
Welcome to My Dev Notes 👋 This site contains my personal development notes, cheatsheets, and useful commands.

Feel free to explore topics like Docker, Kubernetes, and more!

  • Docker Cheatsheet
  • Kubernetes Cheatsheet
  • iOS Cheatsheet

docs.title: Image Commands
docs.text:
• docker build — Build an image from a Dockerfile
  • docker images — List images
  • docker rmi — Remove one or more images
  • docker tag — Tag an image for a repository

docs.title: Container Commands
docs.text:
• docker run — Run a container
  • docker ps — List running containers
  • docker stop — Stop one or more running containers
  • docker start — Start one or more stopped containers
  • docker restart — Restart containers
  • docker rm — Remove one or more containers
  • docker exec — Run a command inside a running container
  • docker logs — Fetch logs from a container

docs.title: Volume Commands
docs.text:
• docker volume create — Create a volume
  • docker volume ls — List volumes
  • docker volume rm — Remove a volume

docs.title: Network Commands
docs.text:
• docker network create — Create a network
  • docker network ls — List networks
  • docker network rm — Remove a network

docs.title: System Commands
docs.text:
• docker system prune — Remove unused data
  • docker info — Display system-wide information
  • docker version — Show Docker version info

docs.title: Xcode Shortcuts
docs.text:
• Cmd + B → Build
  • Cmd + R → Run
  • Cmd + Shift + K → Clean

docs.title: Get Resources
docs.text:
• kubectl get pods — List pods
  • kubectl get services — List services
  • kubectl get deployments — List deployments
  • kubectl get nodes — List nodes
  • kubectl get namespaces — List namespaces

docs.title: Describe Resources
docs.text:
• kubectl describe pod <pod-name>
  • kubectl describe node <node-name>
  • kubectl describe deployment <deployment-name>

docs.title: Logs and Exec
docs.text:
• kubectl logs <pod-name> — View logs of a pod
  • kubectl exec -it <pod-name> -- /bin/bash — Exec into a pod shell

docs.title: Apply and Delete
docs.text:
• kubectl apply -f <file.yaml> — Apply config from file
  • kubectl delete -f <file.yaml> — Delete resources from file

docs.title: Scaling and Updating
docs.text:
• kubectl scale deployment <name> --replicas=<num> — Scale deployment
  • kubectl rollout status deployment/<name> — Check rollout status
  • kubectl rollout undo deployment/<name> — Rollback deployment

docs.title: Miscellaneous
docs.text:
• kubectl config view — Show kubeconfig
  • kubectl config use-context <context-name> — Switch context
  • kubectl top pod — Show pod resource usage (if metrics-server installed)
